solution_line_template: Roberto has received 2 raises. On his first raise he received a {first_raise_percent_text}% bump, therefore his new salary was ${starting_salary} * {first_raise_factor_percent}% = $<<{starting_salary}*{first_raise_factor_percent}*{percent_to_decimal_factor}={salary_after_first_raise}>>{salary_after_first_raise}

On his second raise, Roberto received a {second_raise_percent_text}% bump, therefore his current salary is ${salary_after_first_raise} * {second_raise_factor_percent}% = $<<{salary_after_first_raise}*{second_raise_factor_percent}*{percent_to_decimal_factor}={current_salary}>>{current_salary}
